Title: Store Fields on Index
DescriptionLines: Querying an index results with matching documents that satisfy the query.
However, **when one of the index fields is computed and you want to get its value in the query results then Store the Field on the Index**
otherwise you need to re-calculate the value once results return.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the Map index class
DescriptionLines: * Create the Map index class - inherit from `AbstractIndexCreationTask`.
* The generic params:
* _Order_ - indicates that the source collection for the index will be the 'Orders' collection

* _OrdersQuantity_ByCompany.IndexEntry_ - is the shape of the resulting index-fields
(see next step)

Walkthroughs.Title: The index Entry class
DescriptionLines:
* The IndexEntry class defines the _index-fields per entry_ in the index.
These fields will be indexed and can be queried on.
* The _content_ for each index-field is configured in the index constructor (see next step).
* Field _TotalItemsOrdered_ will be computed and stored on the index (Step 5).

Walkthroughs.Title: The projected class
DescriptionLines: * `OrderProjectedDetails` will contain the details projected per document result.
Used in step 6.
* Note: it is not mandatory for this class to be nested within the index class.

Walkthroughs.Title: The Index Map
DescriptionLines: * The _Map function_ defines the index-fields content - which fields from the 'Order' entity will compose each index-field.
* The index built will contain a list of indexed terms for each index-field specified in the Map function, and a mapping to the relevant document.
* These indexed terms can later be queried on to get their matching documents, the documents that contain them.
* In this example, field `TotalItemsOrdered` is computed and will be stored on the index in the next step.

Walkthroughs.Title: Store field on Index
DescriptionLines: * Use `Store.Add()` to store a field on the index.
* At query time, the value will be fetched directly from the index instead of from the document store.
* Note: Storing fields on the index will increase the index size on disk.

Walkthroughs.Title: Query for documents
DescriptionLines: * Query the 'Orders' collection using the defined index.
* The orders' documents can be _filtered_ by the index-fields defined in `OrdersQuantity_ByCompany.IndexEntry`
* The resulting documents will include only orders that where made by 'companyId'.

Walkthroughs.Title: Project Results
DescriptionLines: * Use `ProjectInto()` to make the server return only the fields defined in the 'OrdersQuantity_ByCompany.OrderProjectedDetails' class per document result instead of the whole document.
* If the field is _stored on the index_ - the server will fetch it from the index
* If the field is _not stored on the index_ - the server will fetch it from the document store
* In this example:
* 'TotalItemsOrdered' is fetched from the index
*  'OrderedAt' if fetched from the document store
* Method _Select()_ can be used instead of ProjectInfo(). See related links.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the Query
DescriptionLines: * The _ordersQuery_ variable only stores the query definition.
Execute the query by calling `ToList()`, or any other method that forces immediate execution.
* The final query results include the projected details for orders that where made by 'companyId'.
* The resulting objects are Not tracked by the session since they are not the stored documents but only partial data.
